pr_title: Initial load trigger load for single asset

timeline.message:
Created endpoint to trigger initial load for a single entity

Signed-off-by: marius-patrascu <marius-florin.patrascu@ing.com>

timeline.bodyText: method name does not match should be "publishEntity" for better traceability
timeline.author: lpalashevski
lpalashevski
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -37,4 +37,21 @@ public GUIDListResponse publishEntities(@PathVariable String serverName,
                                             @PathVariable String entityType) {
         return restAPI.publishEntities(serverName, userId, entityType);
     }
+
+    /**
+     * Find the entity by guid and publish the context for it
+     *
+     * @param serverName name of server instance to call
+     * @param userId     the name of the calling user
+     * @param guid       the guid of the entity to build context
+     * @param entityType the name of the relationship type
+     * @return a list of unique identifiers (guids) of the available entity with the given type provided as a response
+     */
+    @GetMapping(path = "/publish-entity/{entityType}/guid/{guid}")

timeline.bodyText: Thinking about this better now, does not seem like ERROR. There can be valid entity that does not have relationships and what asset lineage should do is log this as INFO because of the fact that it is filtering it out. Also suggesting to skip sending the lineage event (otherwise we are sending empty lineage events). This also applies for similar method "publishProcessContext"
timeline.author: lpalashevski

timeline.message:
changes after pull review

Signed-off-by: marius-patrascu <marius-florin.patrascu@ing.com>
